definition: willingly and gladly (idiom)
surname Gan/abbr. for Gansu Province 甘肅省|甘肃省[Gan1 su4 Sheng3]
sweet/willing
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
feeling/emotion/passion/situation
honest/prudent/variant of 願|愿[yuan4]
to hope/to wish/to desire/hoped-for/ready/willing

sentences.english: Now are we willing to be, to do, or to suffer as the LORD wills.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们甘心情愿地愿意为上帝而活，为上帝受苦。

sentences.english: That oblivion, however, would not be a matter of Chiang's own choosing.
sentences.chinese: 但是蒋介石自己决不会甘心情愿就此默默无闻。

definition: delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
willingly
to be willing/to be satisfied
see 死心塌地[si3 xin1 ta1 di4]
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
no complaints/to have no regrets
to be willing to/to resign oneself to
to give oneself wholly to/to put oneself at sb's service/(of a woman) to give one's body to/to marry
lit. as sweet as syrup (idiom, from Book of Songs); to endure hardship gladly/a glutton for punishment
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
selfless/self-sacrifice (to help others)/self-renunciation/altruism
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
willingness/would rather (agree to X than Y)
to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence
to accept a compromise
